text_representation package¶

Submodules¶

text_representation.batch_emb module¶

Return vectorized batch-wise representation of a given textual docs or phrases. Uses scikit-learn, spacy and tensorflow-hub modules. Most useful tensorflow hub URLs are mentioned below.

https://tfhub.dev/google/elmo/2 https://tfhub.dev/google/bert_uncased_L-12_H-768_A-12/1 https://tfhub.dev/google/universal-sentence-encoder-large/3

@author: Nikhil Pattisapu, iREL, IIIT-H.

text_representation.batch_emb.avg_elmo_emb(texts, module_url='https://tfhub.dev/google/elmo/2', tf_batch_size=64, gpu_id=None, batch_size=32)¶

Yields averaged sentence Elmo representation of batches of phrases or text

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • module_url (String, optional. Default is https://tfhub.dev/google/elmo/2) – TFHub module URL for Elmo model.
  • tf_batch_size (int, optional, default is 64) – Number of strings to be processed in a single batch of Elmo Tensorflow Hub model.
  • gpu_id (string (to be used by os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] optional, Default is None (Use System specified value)) – The default GPU ID which has to be used to run Elmo pre-trained model
  • batch_size (int, optional, default is 32) – The batch size of the representation
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy matrix.
text_representation.batch_emb.avg_sent_emb(texts, nlp=None, model_type='en_core_web_lg', n_vectors=None, batch_size=32)¶

Yields averaged word embedding based representation of batches of texts.

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings.) – list of documents.
  • nlp (optional, spacy model object. Default is en_core_web_lg) – Spacy NLP Model preloaded in memory
  • model_type (string, optional (default word2vec vectors)) – Model type used for various word embeddings
  • n_vectors (int, optional, default is None) – Number of vectors to keep
  • batch_size (int, optional, default is 32) – The batch size of the representation
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy sparse matrix.
text_representation.batch_emb.avg_use_emb(texts, module_url='https://tfhub.dev/google/ universal-sentence-encoder-large/3', tf_batch_size=64, gpu_id=None, batch_size=32)¶

Yields averaged sentence universal sentence encoding representation of batches of phrases or texts.

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • module_url (String, optional. Default is https://tfhub.dev/google/universal-sentence-encoder-large/3) – TFHub module URL for pre-trained Universal Sentence Encoder model.
  • tf_batch_size (int, optional, default is 64) – Number of strings to be processed in a single batch of Universal Sentence Encoder Tensorflow Hub model.
  • gpu_id (string (to be used by os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] optional, Default is None (Use System specified value)) – The default GPU ID which has to be used to run Elmo pre-trained model
  • batch_size (int, optional, default is 32) – The batch size of the representation
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy matrix.
text_representation.batch_emb.avg_word_emb(texts, nlp=None, model_type='en_core_web_lg', n_vectors=None, batch_size=32)¶

Yields averaged word embedding based representation of batches of texts.

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings.) – list of documents.
  • nlp (optional, spacy model object. Default is en_core_web_lg) – Spacy NLP Model preloaded in memory
  • model_type (string, optional (default word2vec vectors)) – Model type used for various word embeddings
  • n_vectors (None, int, optional) – Number of vectors to keep
  • batch_size (int, optional, default is 32) – The batch size of the representation
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy sparse matrix.
text_representation.batch_emb.bert_emb(texts, batch_size=32)¶

Yields BERT representation of batches of phrase or text. In order for this function to yield embeddings it needs to meet the following prerequisite. There should be a server running in the background which serves bert embedding. The commands for starting and terminating the servers are mentioned below

  • bert-serving-start -model_dir=~/uncased_L-12_H-768_A-12
  • bert-serving-terminate -port_in 5555.

For other useful options look at bert-serving-start –help and bert-serving-terminate –help.

In order to install the above mentioned server please visit to the following sources:

  • https://bert-as-service.readthedocs.io/en/latest/source/server.html
  • https://github.com/hanxiao/bert-as-service
Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • batch_size (int, optional, default is 32) – The batch size of the representation
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts.
Return type:

A numpy matrix.
text_representation.batch_emb.elmo_emb(texts, module_url='https://tfhub.dev/google/elmo/2', tf_batch_size=64, gpu_id=None, batch_size=32)¶

Yields Elmo representation of batches of phrases or texts

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • module_url (String, optional. Default is https://tfhub.dev/google/elmo/2) – TFHub module URL for Elmo model.
  • tf_batch_size (int, optional, default is 64) – Number of strings to be processed in a single batch of Elmo Tensorflow Hub model.
  • gpu_id (string (to be used by os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] optional, Default is None (Use System specified value)) – The default GPU ID which has to be used to run Elmo pre-trained model
  • batch_size (int, optional, default is 32) – The batch size of the representation
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy sparse matrix.
text_representation.batch_emb.use_emb(texts, module_url='https://tfhub.dev/google/universal-sentence-encoder-large/3', tf_batch_size=64, gpu_id=None, batch_size=32)¶

Yields Universal Sentence Encoder representation of batches of phrases or text

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • module_url (String, optional. Default is https://tfhub.dev/google/universal-sentence-encoder-large/3) – TFHub module URL for pre-trained Universal Sentence Encoder model.
  • tf_batch_size (int, optional, default is 64) – Number of strings to be processed in a single batch of Universal Sentence Encoder Tensorflow Hub model.
  • gpu_id (string (to be used by os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] optional, Default is None (Use System specified value)) – The default GPU ID which has to be used to run Elmo pre-trained model
  • batch_size (int, optional, default is 32) – The batch size of the representation
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy sparse matrix.

text_representation.text_emb module¶

Return vectorized representation of a given textual docs or phrases. Uses scikit-learn, spacy and tensorflow-hub modules. Most useful tensorflow hub URLs are mentioned below.

https://tfhub.dev/google/elmo/2 https://tfhub.dev/google/bert_uncased_L-12_H-768_A-12/1 https://tfhub.dev/google/universal-sentence-encoder-large/3

@author: Nikhil Pattisapu, iREL, IIIT-H.

text_representation.text_emb.avg_elmo_emb(texts, module_url='https://tfhub.dev/google/elmo/2', tf_batch_size=64, gpu_id=None, max_sent_len=40)¶

Return the averaged sentence Elmo representation of the phrase or text.

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • tf_batch_size (int, optional, default is 64) – Number of strings to be processed in a single batch of Elmo Tensorflow Hub model.
  • gpu_id (string (to be used by os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] optional, Default is None (Use System specified value)) – The default GPU ID which has to be used to run Elmo pre-trained model
  • max_sent_len (int, optional, default is 40.) – Maximum number of words per sentence. If a sentence is found to be larger than this then it is split into multiple sentences.
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts.
Return type:

A numpy matrix.
text_representation.text_emb.avg_sent_emb(texts, nlp=None, model_type='en_core_web_lg', n_vectors=None)¶

Return averaged sentence embedding based representation of texts. A sentence embedding is obtained by averaging the word embeddings of the words present in it.

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings.) – list of documents.
  • nlp (optional, spacy model object.) – Spacy NLP Model preloaded in memory
  • model_type (string, optional (default word2vec vectors)) – Model type used for various word embeddings
  • n_vectors (None, int, optional) – Number of vectors to keep. Setting a small value results in faster speed at the cost of reduced accuracy. Can be used for quick testing.
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy matrix.
text_representation.text_emb.avg_use_emb(texts, module_url='https://tfhub.dev/google/universal-sentence-encoder-large/3', tf_batch_size=64, gpu_id=None, max_sent_len=40)¶

Return averaged sentence universal sentence encoding representation of the phrase or text.

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • tf_batch_size (int, optional, default is 64) – Number of strings to be processed in a single batch of Universal Sentence Encoder Tensorflow Hub model.
  • gpu_id (string (to be used by os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] optional, Default is None (Use System specified value)) – The default GPU ID which has to be used to run Elmo pre-trained model
  • max_sent_len (int, optional, default is 40.) – Maximum number of words per sentence. If a sentence is found to be larger than this then it is split into multiple sentences.
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts.
Return type:

A numpy matrix.
text_representation.text_emb.avg_word_emb(texts, nlp=None, model_type='en_core_web_lg', n_vectors=None)¶

Return averaged word embedding based representation of texts.

Parameters:

  • nlp (optional, spacy model object.) – Spacy NLP Model preloaded in memory
  • model_type (string, optional (default word2vec vectors)) – Model type used for various word embeddings

Returns:

A matrix representing the texts

A numpy matrix.
text_representation.text_emb.bert_emb(texts)¶

Return BERT representation of the phrase or text. In order for this function to return embeddings it needs to meet the following prerequisite. There should be a server running in the background which serves bert embedding. The commands for starting and terminating the servers are mentioned below

  • bert-serving-start -model_dir=~/uncased_L-12_H-768_A-12
  • bert-serving-terminate -port_in 5555.

For other useful options look at bert-serving-start –help and bert-serving-terminate –help.

In order to install the above mentioned server please visit to the following sources:

  • https://bert-as-service.readthedocs.io/en/latest/source/server.html
  • https://github.com/hanxiao/bert-as-service
Parameters:texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
Returns:A matrix representing the texts.
Return type:A numpy matrix.
text_representation.text_emb.elmo_emb(texts, module_url='https://tfhub.dev/google/elmo/2', tf_batch_size=64, gpu_id=None)¶

Return Elmo representation of the phrase or text

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • tf_batch_size (int, optional, default is 64) – Number of strings to be processed in a single batch of Elmo Tensorflow Hub model.
  • gpu_id (string (to be used by os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] optional, Default is None (Use System specified value)) – The default GPU ID which has to be used to run Elmo pre-trained model
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy matrix.
text_representation.text_emb.tfidf(texts, vectorizer=None)¶

Return the TF-IDF representation corresponding to texts.

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings.) – list of documents.
  • vectorizer (optional, sklearn.feature_extraction.text.TfidfVectorizer) – A fitted Sklearn’s TFIDF vectorizer
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts
Return type:

A numpy sparse matrix.
text_representation.text_emb.use_emb(texts, module_url='https://tfhub.dev/google/universal-sentence-encoder-large/3', tf_batch_size=64, gpu_id=None)¶

Return Universal Sentence Encoder representation of the phrase or text

Parameters:
  • texts (list of strings) – list of documents or phrases
  • tf_batch_size (int, optional, default is 64) – Number of strings to be processed in a single batch of Universal Sentence Encoder Tensorflow Hub model.
  • gpu_id (string (to be used by os.environ['CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES'] optional, Default is None (Use System specified value)) – The default GPU ID which has to be used to run Elmo pre-trained model
Returns:

A matrix representing the texts.
Return type:

A numpy matrix.

text_representation.utilities module¶

This module contains the utility functions which are called by other modules of text representation package

@author: Nikhil Pattisapu, iREL, IIIT-H.

text_representation.utilities.avg_vectors(matrix, row_ids)¶

Returns the document embedding given the sentence embedding matrix consisting of one sentence vecter per row.

Parameters:
  • matrix (A 2D numpy matrix.) – sentence embedding matrix. Each row cosists of sentence embedding. The matrix spans the sentence embeddings of several documents.
  • row_ids (List of integers.) – A list containing the number of sentences in each document.
Returns:

Document embedding matrix (using averaged sentence embedding)
Return type:

A 2D numpy matrix.
text_representation.utilities.batchify(inp, batch_size)¶

A utility function. Batchifies a given python sequence or numpy matrix

text_representation.utilities.get_sentences(texts, max_sent_len)¶

Tokenizes text and returns sentences as well as number of sentences per sample

Parameters:
  • texts (A list of strings) – A list of phrases or texts
  • max_sent_len (int) – Maximum number of words per sentence. Sentences longer than this would be split into multiple sentences.
Returns:

A tuple consisting of 2 lists. First one cosists of list of tokenized sentences. The second one consists of number of sentences in each document or text
Return type:

Tuple
text_representation.utilities.get_spacy_sent_tokenizer()¶

A Utility function which returns the minimalist spacy model with just sentence tokenizer

text_representation.utilities.run_tfhub(texts, tf_model, tf_placeholder, tf_batch_size, gpu_id=None)¶

Run the Tensorflow model and return the text embedding

Parameters:
  • texts (A list of strings) – A list of phrases or texts
  • tf_model (Tensorflow hub model.) – A tensorflow model comprising of the graph which needs to be run.
  • tf_placeholder (tf.string) – A placeholder for text
  • tf_batch_size (int.) – The number of textual items to be processed in a single batch
  • gpu_id (string) – The GPU IDs which are to be used for this computation
Returns:

The text representation.
Return type:

A numpy matrix.
